intro: Gomesa pubes, commonly known as the hairy gomesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in dense inflorescences. Gomesa pubes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
